column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Drunk and beligerent with a party of 8 5 minutes before they closed.  We called ahead to make sure they wouldn't mind
column2: and they told us to come on in
column3: so we did.  We didn't leave until like 1:15 on Saturday
column4: which means we kept the staff there way too long.  Not once were we asked to leave or hurry up or anything
column5: the just kept serving us picthers.  Great service
column6: great food.  Lou's is just as good as any other Chicago style pizza
column7: to settle for one pizza place would be a disheartening experience
column8: so I would also recommend Nancy's Pizza
column9: which is pretty much the same as Lou's.
